clinical_study.brief_title: Study of AMG 706 in Subjects With Advanced Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors (GISTs)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Study of AMG 706 in Subjects With Advanced Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors (GISTs) Who Developed Progressive Disease or Relapsed While on Imatinib Mesylate

brief_summary.textblock: This study will determine the safety and effectiveness of AMG 706 in patients with advanced GIST.

detailed_description.textblock: Expanded Access: Amgen provides expanded access for this clinical trial. Contact the Amgen Call Center (866-572-6436) for more information.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate as defined using modified RECIST criteria.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 48 weeks treatment or until progressive disease, or unacceptable toxicity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time from randomization to progressive disease
time from response to progressive disease
time from first treatment to response

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of opioid analgesics after minimal 6 months treatment
Objective response by PET and tumor size/density changes at week 8
Objective response by size changes and/or target tumor density changes at week 8
Safety Endpoints: Incidence of adverse events (including all, serious, grade 3, grade 4 and treatment related)
Pharmacokinetic Endpoints: 1. The AMG 706 PK parameters (Cmax, t1/2, AUC0-24, C24); 2. To explore the PK/PD relationships

intervention.description: AMG 706 125 mg daily for 48 weeks, or until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity.

Efficacy and safety of motesanib, an oral inhibitor of VEGF, PDGF, and Kit receptors, in patients with imatinib-resistant gastrointestinal stromal tumors. Cancer Chemother Pharmacol. 2011 Jul;68(1):69-77. doi: 10.1007/s00280-010-1431-9. Epub 2010 Sep 14.
